vge/vgArray.h

00001 #ifndef __RIARRAY_H
00002 #define __RIARRAY_H
00003 
00004 #include <string.h> //for memcpy
00005 
00006 //  An array class similar to std::vector.
00007 // \note        Follows std::vector's naming convention (except resizeAndReallocate).
00008 template <class Item> class Array
00009 {
00010 public:
00011     Array() : m_array(NULL), m_size(0), m_allocated(0) {}   //throws bad_alloc
00012     ~Array()
00013     {
00014         delete [] m_array;
00015     }
00016 
00017     void        swap(Array& s)
00018     {
00019         Item* tarray = m_array;
00020         m_array = s.m_array;
00021         s.m_array = tarray;
00022 
00023         int tsize = m_size;
00024         m_size = s.m_size;
00025         s.m_size = tsize;
00026 
00027         int tallocated = m_allocated;
00028         m_allocated = s.m_allocated;
00029         s.m_allocated = tallocated;
00030     }
00031 
00032     //if more room is needed, reallocate, otherwise return
00033     void        reserve( int items )    //throws bad_alloc
00034     {
00035         assert( items >= 0 );
00036         if( items <= m_allocated )
00037             return; //if there is room already, return
00038 
00039         assert( items > m_allocated );
00040 
00041         Item* newa = new Item[items];   //throws bad_alloc if runs out of memory
00042         for(int i=0;i<m_size;i++)
00043             newa[i] = m_array[i];
00044         delete [] m_array;
00045         m_array = newa;
00046         m_allocated = items;
00047         //doesn't change size
00048     }
00049 
00050     //reserve and change size
00051     void        resize( int items ) //throws bad_alloc
00052     {
00053         reserve( items );   //throws bad_alloc if runs out of memory
00054         m_size = items;
00055     }
00056 
00057     //resize and allocate exactly the correct amount of memory
00058     void        resizeAndReallocate( int items )    //throws bad_alloc
00059     {
00060         assert( items >= 0 );
00061         if( items == m_allocated )
00062         {
00063             m_size = items;
00064             return;
00065         }
00066 
00067         if( items == 0 )
00068         {
00069             delete [] m_array;
00070             m_size = 0;
00071             m_allocated = 0;
00072             return;
00073         }
00074 
00075         Item* newa = new Item[items];   //throws bad_alloc if runs out of memory
00076         int copySize = (m_size < items) ? m_size : items;   //min(m_size,items)
00077         for(int i=0;i<copySize;i++)
00078             newa[i] = m_array[i];
00079         RI_DELETE_ARRAY(m_array);
00080         m_array = newa;
00081         m_allocated = items;
00082         m_size = items;     //changes also size
00083     }
00084     void        clear()
00085     {
00086         m_size = 0;
00087     }
00088     void        push_back( const Item& item )   //throws bad_alloc
00089     {
00090         if( m_size >= m_allocated )
00091             reserve( (!m_allocated) ? 8 : m_allocated * 2 );    //by default, reserve 8. throws bad_alloc if runs out of memory
00092         m_array[m_size++] = item;
00093     }
00094     Item&       pop_back()  //throws bad_alloc
00095     {
00096         if( m_size > 0 )
00097             return m_array[--m_size];
00098         return m_array[0];
00099     }
00100     int         size() const                { return m_size; }
00101     Item&       operator[](int i)           { assert(i >= 0 && i < m_size); return m_array[i]; }
00102     const Item& operator[](int i) const     { assert(i >= 0 && i < m_size); return m_array[i]; }
00103 
00104 private:
00105     Array(const Array& s);              
00106     void operator=(const Array& s);     
00107 
00108     Item*       m_array;
00109     int         m_size;
00110     int         m_allocated;
00111 };
00112 
00113 #endif /* __RIARRAY_H */
